page.title: 08Twinning Wendover/Liffre
page.content: Since 1976 when a Charter was signed by the Mayor of Liffre in France and the Chairman of Wendover Parish Council, an active twinning arrangement has developed between the two towns. Liffre is a small town, population 4000, in the Ile et Vilaine department of Brittany and the population of Wendover is 7,200. The nearest city to Liffre is Rennes. The John Colet Secondary School went on an initial visit to the corresponding school in Liffre and since then links between the two communities have been developed between football matches, orchestra visits and regular school exchanges. At this point, in 1985 discussions are being suggested regarding a triangular arrangement with a town in Germany.
